page.title: 01Middle Valley of Glendaruel
page.content: The river ruel meanders along the floor of the glaciated valley which runs from N E to S W through this block. The floor of the valley, the western side and onto the tops are used mainly for hill sheep and cattle raising with a small amount of natural afforestation with one small plantation of conifers. The east side is mainly taken over by the forestry commission including a small quarry used by them. The rest is rough graing. One farm and a modern bungalow lie on the single-track road on the westside of the valley, with a ruined village part way up the hillside. The main road runs down the east side of the valley and has several individual houses and two groups. Beside one group are forestry offices and cold store.
